result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence H Jamison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $1,000.00 PLUS all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments to be paid within 1 year (by 02-08-2018). Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
Provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Credit for 4 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement upon successful completion of this sentence

Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement and cannot vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence H Jamison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement upon successful completion of this sentence

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  
Dennis Murphy for Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

Matter before the Court for pretrial conference.  Hearing proceeds.

Amended Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Charge amended to COUNT 1:  MANUFACTURE/DELIVER THC (TETRAHYDROCANNABINOLS) (<=200 G), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s), 961.41(1)(h)1, 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Negotiations set forth by the state and confirmed by defense.

Defendant advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties.  Defendant advised that he MUST provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute, and that he cannot vote until civil rights are restored.  Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.  

The Court reiterates to the defendant the felony warnings/admonishments given during plea colloquy.

The Court sentenced to served 4 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
  
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 plus all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments to be paid within 1 year (by 2-08-18); any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  The Court finds the defendant ELIGIBLE for expungement upon successful completion of this sentence.
Filed,
-Plea Questionnaire
-Addendum to Plea Questionnaire
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  
Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  OFF THE RECORD, Branch 11 in jury trial.
Defense awaiting offer from the state.  Case adjourned before Branch 11.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound the defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Discovery turned over in open court.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence H Jamison
Current: 2130 N Hubbard St., Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 01-10-2017)
Prior: 2236 S. 68th Street, West Allis, WI 53219
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/24/15 @ 1:30pm
